commands.name: db-dump
commands.help: Creates database backups.

databases.name: databases
databases.description: Databases for backup. Available Values: [ main quote sales ]. If the argument value is not specified, database backups will be created using the credentials stored in the `MAGENTO_CLOUD_RELATIONSHIP` environment variable or/and the `stage.deploy.DATABASE_CONFIGURATION` property of the .magento.env.yaml configuration file.

remove-definers.name: --remove-definers
remove-definers.description: Remove definers from the database dump

dump-directory.description: Use alternative directory for saving dump

commands.name: help
commands.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools help list</info>

You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools help --format=xml list</info>

To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: list
commands.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools list</info>

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools list test</info>

You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools list --format=xml</info>

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

  <info>php ./bin/ece-tools list --raw</info>

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
